title: Gordon Ramsay’s 6-month-old son Oscar gets behind the wheel of Ferrari
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

If you need a shot of cuteness today, may we direct your attention to Gordon Ramsay and his adorable six-month-old son Oscar getting behind the wheel of a Ferrari.

It’s baby’s first Ferrari!

They’re not moving, sure, however the vibe is still cuter than a button as the TV chef strapped himself into the swanky car before being handed his youngest to introduce him to the world of fancy AF vehicles.

Advertisement

The school run has never looked the same.

The 52-year-old looked delighted as little Oscar jumped on his lap in the £1.5million Ferrari Monza SP, which is apparently on loan to him.

Gordon and his man Oscar (Picture: @gordongram)

Yes, that’s right, a baby has a better car than you we’re very sorry to say.

In the video posted by the Ferrari dealership, Gordon sat patiently in the car as he said: ‘First job of the day, the school run. Oscar! Let’s go captain.’

It was then Oscar was handed over by Gordon’s wife Tana, as the two prepared to turn on the engine and get that baby revving (the car, not Oscar).

He continued, as Tana proudly captured the moment on her phone: ‘Hands on the wheel at all time, indicators, check the mirror. Are we ready?’

It comes after the celebrity chef admitted he fainted during the recent birth of son Oscar.

Gordon and wife Tana welcomed Oscar in April (Picture: PA)

Gordon and Tana – who also have children Megan, 21, 19-year-old twins Holly and Jack, and 17-year-old Matilda – welcomed their fifth baby on 4 April, with the chef confirming his arrival on Instagram.

Sharing snaps of his radiant wife cradling their son, he wrote: ‘After 3 baftas and one Emmy… finally we have won an Oscar, please welcome Oscar James Ramsay, who touched down at 12:58 today for some lunch!’

The Kitchen Nightmares star appeared on The Jonathan Ross Show and revealed that wife Tana wouldn’t allow him to be in the room at the births of his four other children, but this time she made an exception.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Tana didn’t want to see me there for previous births,’ he told Wossy.

‘She said, “I don’t want you to see me in this state so get out.” This time I was there and I absolutely crapped my pants.’

The chef confessed the experience was just too much for him and he collapsed upon watching his wife give birth.

‘I fainted,’ he continued. ‘I literally dropped on the floor. I was sat there and Oscar popped out through the sunroof and then they sort of throw you on him and he’s screaming and I fell back, the nurse grabbed me.’

One thing’s for sure, that car will take your breath away all the same.
